label: 正念
本: Jewel in the Ashes: Buddha Relics and Power in Early Medieval Japan . Harvard University Asia Center . 2000
説明文: Cheng-nien (Ch.)  正念, sometimes called  大休正念 (Ch. Ta-hsiu cheng-nien; J. Daikyū shōnen), with the posthumous name of  Butsugen zenji (仏源禅師).  Chinese monk who arrived in in Japan in 1268, and through the favor of Hōjō Tokimune resided in the Zenkōji (Meigetsu'in), Jufukuji, and Kenchōji, before moving at the end of his life to Engakuji, where he died in 1289.
